properties.areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands; Eastern Alaska Range; Denali; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Deltana and Tanana Flats
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 8 at 11:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
Temperatures across the Interior are expected to fall sharply
into the 20s to 40s below this week.

Cold air will push southeast across the Interior beginning early
Monday, reaching the southeastern Interior Tuesday.

20s to 30s below are expected across the middle and upper Tanana
Valley. Typical cold spots could see 40s below or colder. Farther
north across the Yukon Flats and southern Brooks Range, expect
widespread 30s to 40s below.

Models show a considerable spread in temperatures later in the
week, so there is fairly low confidence in the long term forecast.
For now we expect cold temperatures to linger throughout the
week.

Residents should prepare for cold temperatures, especially if
traveling, by keeping cold weather gear available at all times.

For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/afg

NWSheadline: Cold Temperatures to Return this Week
